question.title: When i use Assert.assertFalse(), to check the absence of an element, my scripts are getting failed
question.body:
Assert.assertFalse(driver.findElement(By.xpath("element's xpath")).isDisplayed(),
            "Bug!! The element is appeared");

When i run my code with the above script, my scripts are failing with the statement like "can't find the element, (Which is mentioned int he element's xpath)" Now what i have to do? My notion is to verify the element is not present in the screen

answers.body:
I know this question is old but it's shown back up on the front page and doesn't have an accepted answer...

The problem with your assert is that if the element doesn't exist, Selenium throws the NoSuchElementException. To avoid this, use .findElements() (plural) and then check the size of the returned list. If the list contains an element, then check for visible. The code looks like the below.

List<WebElement> e = driver.findElements(By.xpath("element's xpath"));
if (!e.isEmpty()) {
    Assert.assertFalse(e.get(0).isDisplayed(), "Bug!! The element is visible.");
}
